trigger.name: MySQL: too many aborted connections on {HOSTNAME}

dependency.name: MySQL: mysqld is not running on {HOSTNAME}

item.name: MySQL: created tmp tables on disk
MySQL: created tmp files on disk
MySQL: created tmp tables on memory
MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool hit ratio
item.description: The InnoDB Buffer Pool hit ratio is a indicator how often your pages are retrieved from memory instead of disk

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages data
item.description: The number of pages containing data (dirty or clean)

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages dirty
item.description: The number of pages currently dirty

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages flushed
item.description: The number of buffer pool page-flush requests

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages free
item.description: The number of free pages

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages misc
item.description: The number of pages that are busy because they have been allocated for administrative overhead such as row locks or the adaptive hash index. This value can also be calculated as Innodb_buffer_pool_pages_total - Innodb_buffer_pool_pages_free - Innodb_buffer_pool_pages_data

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool pages total
item.description: The total size of buffer pool, in pages

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool reads
item.description: The number of logical reads that InnoDB could not satisfy from the buffer pool, and had to read directly from the disk.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool read ahead rnd
item.description: The number of “random” read-aheads initiated by InnoDB. This happens when a query scans a large portion of a table but in random order.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool read ahead
item.description: The number of sequential read-aheads initiated by InnoDB. This happens when InnoDB does a sequential full table scan.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool read requests
item.description: The number of logical read requests

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool wait free
item.description: Normally, writes to the InnoDB buffer pool happen in the background. However, if it is necessary to read or create a page and no clean pages are available, it is also necessary to wait for pages to be flushed first. This counter counts instances of these waits. If the buffer pool size has been set properly, this value should be small.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB buffer pool write requests
item.description: The number writes done to the InnoDB buffer pool

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data fsyncs
item.description: The number of fsync() operations so far

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data pending fsyncs
item.description: The current number of pending fsync() operations

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data pending reads
item.description: The current number of pending reads

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data pending writes
item.description: The current number of pending writes

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data reads
item.description: The total number of data reads

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data read
item.description: The amount of data read since the server was started

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data writes
item.description: The total number of data writes

trigger.name: No data for MySQL InnoDB in 15 min

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB data written
item.description: The amount of data written so far, in bytes

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB dblwr pages written
item.description: The number of pages that have been written for doublewrite operations

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB dblwr writes
item.description: The number of doublewrite operations that have been performed

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB log waits
item.description: The number of times that the log buffer was too small and a wait was required for it to be flushed before continuing

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB log writes
item.description: The number of physical writes to the log file

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB log write requests
item.description: The number of log write requests

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB os log fsyncs
item.description: The number of fsync() writes done to the log file

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB os log pending fsyncs
item.description: The number of pending log file fsync() operations

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB os log pending writes
item.description: The number of pending log file writes

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB os log written
item.description: The number of bytes written to the log file

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB pages created
item.description: The number of pages created

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB pages read
item.description: The number of pages read

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB pages written
item.description: The number of pages written

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB page size
item.description: The compiled-in InnoDB page size (default 16KB). Many values are counted in pages; the page size permits them to be easily converted to bytes.

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB rows deleted
item.description: The number of rows deleted from InnoDB tables

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB rows inserted
item.description: The number of rows inserted into InnoDB tables

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB rows read
item.description: The number of rows read from InnoDB tables

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB rows updated
item.description: The number of rows updated in InnoDB tables

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock current waits
item.description: The number of row locks currently being waited for

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock time
item.description: The total time spent in acquiring row locks

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock time avg
item.description: The average time to acquire a row lock

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock time max
item.description: The maximum time to acquire a row lock

item.name: MySQL: InnoDB row lock waits
item.description: The number of times a row lock had to be waited for

trigger.name: MySQL: has just been restarted on {HOSTNAME}
MySQL: mysqld is not running on {HOSTNAME}
